items.headline: U.S. stock futures rise as investors hold out hope for a Christmas rally
items.summary_en: U.S. stock futures gained Sunday, ahead of the holiday-shortened trading week and as investors cling to hopes of a “Santa Claus rally” still to come.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I’m terrified I’ll be homeless when my husband, 76, stops working’: We only have $100K. What happens to people like us?

items.headline: Don’t give up on a ‘Santa Claus rally’ just yet — even after a rough December start for stocks
items.summary_en: Investors may still get the “Santa Claus rally” they had hoped for, even though stocks have struggled to gain momentum so far in December.

items.headline: My husband and I are splitting our estate between his child and my three children. Should they get equal shares?

items.headline: Over age 65? Watch out for these costly mistakes when selling your home.

items.headline: ‘He never asks for anything’: I’m 61 with a $1.5 million 401(k). My girlfriend says I do too much for my son, 28. Is she right?
items.summary_en: “I recently gave him $20,000 for a newer car and had him finance the rest.”

items.headline: ‘It’s heartbreaking’: My cousin died and her estranged husband has taken possession of her home. Can we evict him?
